technology.name: Risen Standard Bearers
technology.description: The mouldering banners of the von Carsteins and other bloodlines may sit hanging in decrepit castles, but standards fallen in battle are surprisingly hard to hoist again with skeletal hands, for the old gods - even Khorne - find it an affront to the act of battle. Within Arkhan's Black Book are cantrips to ease such gods' wrath.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -20% for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Grave Guard units

technology.name: Unnatural Strength
technology.description: There's no way a man without a mind should be able to wield a weapon effectively, but he can, with supernatural help.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors
Number of uses: +1 for "Eternal Empire" (Vlad campaign)

ui_effects.description: ➕ 25% chance to restore up to 2500 Hit Points in 20 seconds
Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

effects.description: Dire Bats units summoned in every battle: +1 (Isabella campaign)

unit_ability.description: Dire Bats units are summoned in every battle

technology.name: The Book of Arkhan
technology.description: Also known as the Tome of Bone, this dread volume, authored by Arkhan the Black, is filled with his secrets for instilling vigour and other deathly abilities into zombified and skeletal vessels.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Grave Guard units

technology.name: Raise Newly Dead
technology.description: Arguably, the simplest Dark Magic rituals raise the newly-dead as Zombies. Even then, a Necromancer must have been steeped in the Dark Arts for years. Yet hidden in the annotations of Arkhan's book is a single word invocation that toughens up Zombies' skin - a useful boon if the reader knows where in the tome to look.

effects.description: Melee attack: +3 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
Melee defence: +3 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
Recruit rank: +2 for Grave Guard and Black Knight units
Recruit rank: +2 for Skeletal and Zombie units

technology.name: Bond of Bones
technology.description: The Bond of Bones is a mantra first concocted by Arkhan the Black. When added to the traditional summoning rituals, Dark Magic becomes much stronger when seeking out skeletal remains. The cost, for there is always a cost in Dark Magic, is a sliver of the spellcaster's already maligned soul.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -50% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.name: Risen Champions
technology.description: Hordes of Zombies and Skeletons rely on their numbers to overwhelm the foe, rather than skill-at-arms. Arkhan's book contains inscriptions that will ensure that champions of the past rise again to join the hordes. This ensures that martial prowess, as well as numbers, can bring about victory.

effects.description: Melee attack: +3 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
Melee defence: +3 for Zombies, Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
Recruit rank: +2 for Skeletal and Zombie units
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Vampire Counts
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Vampire Coast
Missile strength: +25% for Sylvanian Crossbowmen and Sylvanian Handgunners units
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%
Leadership: +5 when fighting against Tomb Kings

technology.name: Bonds of Flesh
technology.description: Blessed be the ties that bind, for they shall last forever.

technology.name: Distribute Grave Gift
technology.description: Those warriors who died in battle and have not had their arms and armour plundered may be buried with it - even if that means being flung into the same charnel pit as the rest of their regiment. This small invocation ensures such buried plate and mail rises to the surface at the same time the skeletons claw their way out of the grave.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units

technology.name: Unearth Cursed Wightblades
technology.description: The Old World is littered with the detritus of war; armour, swords, axes can all be found by simply digging at the site of the battle - and such places are easy to stumble upon! It is harder is to find blades with ancient qualities, blades blessed by forgotten gods. This cantrip finds them, allowing the Necromancer to arm his more capable warriors with the best antiquity has to offer.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Grave Guard and Black Knights units
Armour: +10 for Grave Guard and Black Knights units
Armour-Piercing Melee Damage: +8 for Zombie units
Wardsave: +10% for Grave Guard and Black Knights units

technology.name: Invoke Animalistic Hunger
technology.description: Vargheists were once true von Carsteins, but they have long since lost their noble trappings, becoming desperate beasts and useful tools for Vampires that retain their intellect. According to the bestiary, there is a cantrip that ensures that Vargheists will forever hunger - a despairing hunger that keeps them fierce and desperate to eat.

technology.name: Rotten Gift
technology.description: The coming of death isn't necessarily a disadvantage, and can even prove the most special of boons.

technology.name: Defiler of the Ancient Barrows
technology.description: When entering the barrows of ancient warriors the trespasser must tread lightly, for their may be booby-traps or more eldritch obstacles to prevent raiders. Even previous raiders who failed in their ransacking attempts come back to life as guardians - a bitter irony. However, defiling the barrow - using a guide within the Book of Arkhan - reveals secrets that can prolong the term of the ancient risen.

effects.description: Upkeep: -100% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen
Upkeep: -25% for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen

technology.name: Dread Animator
technology.description: The Dread Animator is a shadowy presence appearing just above the left shoulder of a Necromancer. For an undisclosed price, he will whisper secrets into the spellcaster's ear that will send even the most stubborn Wight back into his mortal remains for service in the Necromancer's legions.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Grave Guard and Black Knights units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Grave Guard and Black Knights units
Armour: +5 for Grave Guard and Black Knights units
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Grave Guard units (minimum 1)
Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Undead
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Undead

technology.name: De Noirot’s Blasphemous Bestiary
technology.description: For centuries, this tome of beasts has been required reading for Necromancers who wish ultimate control, training and mastery of the dread creatures that lurk by the graveside.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Dire Wolves and Fell Bats units

technology.name: Corruptor of the Forests
technology.description: To blight the trees, blacken and twist them, is to create the perfect surrounding for creatures that skulk with the Undead. This may be wolves with black hearts or those who are dead already, or Fell Bats resting between feedings of blood and the bodies of domestic cats.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Fell Bats and Dire Wolves units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Fell Bats and Dire Wolves units

technology.name: Leader of the Pack
technology.description: To glean obedience from the notoriously feral Dire Wolves is to become the alpha whom they follow. The iron will of Vampires and Necromancers alike can achieve this through strength of mind, but the bestiary provides other, more efficient methods to make the hounds eager to join the fray and fight on the reader's behalf.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Dire Wolves units
Missile resistance: 10% for Dire Wolves units

technology.name: Beastmaster
technology.description: Vampires deprived of blood inevitably start to change, their human form slipping to reveal the true monster underneath. They become more bestial, feral creatures. These half-breeds can be controlled by a Vampire that is fully in control of his form or even a Necromancer, when the right words of power are spoken. The beasts are drawn to beings with such dominance.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Varghulf and Vargheists units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Varghulf and Vargheists units

technology.name: Fresh Prey Supply
technology.description: If the Varghulfs and Vargheists' ravenous appetites cannot be kept in check between battles they can become burdensome to control. Wise masters will keep a supply of fresh, preferably still-living prey, ready should the Vampires beasts become all but impossible to control. This maybe a cage of 'breathers' kept within reach for such an occasion or even simply the location of a farmstead or hamlet. Either way, the poor subjects are doomed.

technology.name: Fuelled by Fear
technology.description: The titanic and monstrous Terrorgheists haunt caverns deep in Sylvania's wretched forests and mountains. They are not easy creatures to dominate - only the most determined Beastmaster will try - and yet De Noirot discovered a means to enhance these monsters, making them even deadlier and more terrifying when on the hunt or in battle.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Terrorgheist and Zombie Dragon units
Melee attack: +5 for Terrorgheist and Zombie Dragon units
Charge bonus: +20% for Terrorgheist and Zombie Dragon units
Leadership: +10 for Master Necromancer and Necromancers
Master Necromancer and Necromancers aura size: +100%
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units
Ability: "Ravenous Hunger" for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

technology.name: Master of the Putrid Horde
technology.description: While not the best vessels for war, Zombies are a ready and easily accessible source for any budding Necromancer, especially during battle - as fresh corpses are constantly being 'created'. Those who wish to delve deeper can keep the newly-dead from rotting away by reading a whole sub-chapter in Arkhan's book on the subject, and so become an expert in the putrid hordes.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

technology.name: Master of the Swarm
technology.description: De Noirot's tome contains many rants about entering the minds of the fauna and dominating each creature, forcing them to work as one. There are more efficient ways. By taking control of the most powerful of these creatures the lesser beasts will follow - the true secret to how Vampires can summon and be enveloped by such swarms.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5 for Fell Bats units
Melee defence: +5 for Fell Bats units

technology.name: Blood Hunts
technology.description: Long is the tradition of the blood hunts. The Midnight Aristocracy do not seek out game or boar, like their mortal peers in the Empire. No, it is the smallfolk that are hunted for sport, set loose in the forests with Dire Wolves and Varghulfs quickly on their scent. A terrifying way to die, but that matters not because it makes for better pets.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for all units from the Forest building chain
Upkeep: -10% for Terrorgheist and Zombie Dragon units
Recruit rank: +2 for Terrorgheist and Zombie Dragon units
Miscast base chance: -15% for Master Necromancer and Necromancers
Magic resistance: +15% for Master Necromancer and Necromancers
Attribute: Perfect Vigour for Skeleton Warriors and Skeleton Spearmen units
Recruit rank: +5 for all units from the Forest building chain
Recruit rank: +5 for Corpse Cart, Black Coach and Mortis Engine units
Missile resistance: +20% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Public order: -50% penalty due to presence or lack of corruption

technology.name: Cannibalistic Rituals
technology.description: Ghouls and their larger kin mainly hunt in packs. They may have once been of men, generations ago, but are now little better than beasts. Yet by inscribing a disgusting mark of power on the ground and eating one of their own - usually the weakest of the pack - the Ghouls' claws grow even deadlier.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Speed: +10% for Crypt Ghoul and Crypt Horror units

technology.name: Strigoi Legacy
technology.description: The legacy of the Strigoi runs deep among Ghoul-kind for it was at Mourkain, capital of the Strygos Empire, when they were at the pinnacle of their power. Now, the remnants of that bloodline scavenge amidst the Ghouls, awaiting a return to greatness. It is a racial memory that can be implanted into all Crypt Ghouls, if the correct rituals are used.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Recruit rank: +2 for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units

technology.name: Enshrine Ancient Lords
technology.description: An Undead horde is not made purely from the freshly-dead, many have ancient Chieftains in their ranks. Enshrining or glorifying such creatures, be they Wight Kings or Skeletal Champions, has little effect on the Undead creatures they fight, but can have a morale-sapping effect on mortals still laden with fragilities such as pride and cowardice.

effects.description: Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from non-Vampiric territory attrition

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

required_techs.name: Serve in Life or in Death

technology.name: Blood is Power
technology.description: From blood comes wealth, stature and power. Dark Magic may be the thing Vampires seek, but it is the blood of the living that sustains them. The Lahmian Book of Blood is full of Neferata's teachings on how to control her kin. The retention and giving of blood ensures loyalty, power and wealth.

technology.name: Turning Knightly Orders
technology.description: The Knights of the Order of the Blood Dragon were amongst the first to be turned to Vampirism. Walach Harkon, apprentice to the legendary Vampire warrior Abhorash, challenged them to single combat, defeated each Knight one by one, and turned the ones that impressed him with their martial skills. Many others have since suffered a similar fate, forced to swear unholy oaths of fealty to a new Vampire liege and fight eternally in his name from atop their evil Nightmare steeds.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Blood Knight units
Melee defence: +5 for Blood Knight units
Charge bonus: +20% for Blood Knight units

technology.name: Vampiric Revivification
technology.description: The art of rebirth is a Lahmian technique, although one practised by Blood Dragons and von Carsteins, where a Vampire that has expelled much of his power or is particularly dehydrated is covered in the blood of a hated enemy to allow his complete revivification. This can take place in the his tomb or some other sanctuary, such as his Black Coach when on campaign.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart and Mortis Engine units
Armour: +20 for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, and Mortis Engine units
Charge bonus: +20% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, and Mortis Engine units

technology.name: Delusions of Grandeur
technology.description: All Vampires were once men, with hopes, dreams and families of their own. Though the Blood Kiss has turned them into twisted monsters, few can forget their past, mortal lives. Clinging to their old heraldic symbols, each one is clad in fine silk befitting of a lord or lady, and bestows titles of nobility upon their underlings. Although their ancestral castles crumble, each still boasts an opulent throne room from which the Midnight Aristocracy holds court.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, Mortis Engine, and Blood Knight units
Recruitment cost: -5% for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, Mortis Engine, and Blood Knight units
Recruit rank: +2 for Black Coach, Corpse Cart, Mortis Engine, and Blood Knight units

technology.name: Liber Necronomica
technology.description: A text of powerful binding and one of the nine Books of Nagash. It contains countless rituals to ensnare wrathful spirits, summon ghoulish creatures and imbue such fell things with dread power.

effects.description: Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from non-Vampiric territory attrition

technology.name: Incantations of Ushoran
technology.description: Ushoran was one of the first Vampires, a great warrior and diplomat of Lahmia. However, that was many millennia ago. Over his long life the Vampire rose to greatness, but suffered damnation as a ghoulish Vampire creature, the progenitor of the Strigoi. A specific ritual is said to summon his spirit and imbue all of Ghoul-kind with his hunger.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 5% Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Leadership: +5 for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Upkeep: -10% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Crypt Ghouls and Crypt Horrors units

technology.name: Infuse the Tireless Hordes
technology.description: The dead do not tire, nor do they need sustenance - that is an affliction of the living. Nevertheless, they are bound to travel only as quickly as they can put one rotting leg in front of the other. Infusing the hordes with this incantation will speed up the Undead marchers, although has to be limited lest their legs be worn away!

technology.name: Unliving Siege Engines
technology.description: To be besieged by the dead is to know that the enemy can wait for eternity for your capitulation, should they wish; they do not need to eat, nor will they suffer thirst or disease. But its their war engines that can really shatter a siege - machines of bone that launch the laughing skulls of giants or fire bolts of necromantic energy against the castle walls.

technology.name: The Lahmian Book of Blood
technology.description: Said to be transcribed from scrolls of Neferata herself, this grave codex instructs recently-sired Vampires in the art of infiltrating, influencing and spreading the Vampiric curse across the world.

technology.name: Serve in Life or in Death
technology.description: As a Vampire's forces take control of mortal settlements, the living must quickly adapt to their pitiful new lives, for they may not be living for much longer. The Undead Lord could demand that all be slain and risen as zombies by the next moon rise. But Vampires that cling to their noble trappings prefer to have some 'breathers' about - to terrorise and dominate. Ask the smallfolk of Sylvania...

technology.name: Baleful Rituals
technology.description: The Book of Blood contains evil rituals designed to spread Dark Magic ever outwards. Such incantations are performed at Morrslieb's height, with the leering face of the dark moon staring down into the Vampire Count's gothic castle. With a deathly thrum - like that of a Mortis Engine - the ritual concludes and so the touch of Vampiric corruption spreads, withering flora and bringing death and famine.

technology.name: Spread Vampire Covens
technology.description: Ever since Queen Neferata created the Elixir of Life there have been Vampires hidden in mortal societies. The Lahmians have always done it best, by inveigling themselves into high societies of the living and then subverting those in true power. While the Vampire Counts strike out from Sylvania, there are conclaves within other nations, allowing a fifth column to rise during the wars to come.

technology.name: Blasphemous Disciples
technology.description: A Vampire may gain followers in several ways - although he may simply create them by imparting the Blood Kiss to those he deems worthy, others may be drawn to his rise in power and stature. A test of their loyalty will whittle out the chaff from the useful. Those who pledge their allegiance may then be tasked with the continued quest for power, or so say the scriptures within the Book of Blood.

technology.name: Puppet Master
technology.description: Neferata, in her supreme arrogance, or perhaps a desire for recognition, wrote down her methods for ultimate control in the Book of Blood. At the height of her power, she was the spider at the centre of the web or - to use a more common analogy - the puppet master pulling the strings of her willing servants, as well as those not so... 'pliant'.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Leadership: +10 for Lords and embedded Heroes
Reload time reduction: +25% for towers in siege battles
Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!
Construction time: -1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!
Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!

technology.name: Soulbinder
technology.description: There are many dead languages in the world, some of which have been recorded and etched in dried blood on the pages of the Liber Necronomica. One such litany, when uttered using the exact pronunciations, can summon ethereal hosts to the  speaker. However, if just one syllable is misspoken the summoner will be devoured by the spirits, rather than have them serve him.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units
Recruitment cost: -10% for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units
Magic resistance: 10% for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units
Speed: +10% for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units

technology.name: Nightmarish Reaping
technology.description: A Necromancer must be confident in his abilities to summon Wraiths back from the dead. For, unlike other minions, they hold on to a vestige of intelligence and cunning, and will happily reap the summoner's dread soul if not properly bound. However, a further unholy psalm spoken during the summoning can make these spirits even fiercer and more determined to harvest the spirits of the living.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +20% for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units

technology.name: Spirit Shackles
technology.description: The Liber Necronomica has many rituals that not only summon spiritual malefactors, but shackle them to the Necromancer's will also. This keeps them convalescent far longer than intended in the initial summoning. The Wraiths' malign, if stilted, intellect will no doubt learn from prolonged exposure to their summoner's foes.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units
Recruit rank: +2 for Hexwraiths, Cairn Wraiths and Spirit Hosts units

technology.name: Hexensnacht Sacrifices
technology.description: Hexensnacht is also known as Witching Night, an evil phase of Morrslieb that marks the new year. Creatures of Chaos and darkness are invigorated at such a dark time, Tomb Banshees are imbued with extra strength and murderous need, and Wight Kings stand even more ready to harvest the living.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Wight Kings

technology.name: Infiltrate Noble Houses
technology.description: Arguably, Vlad's greatest triumph was not the siege of Altdorf but before the Vampire Wars even started, when he spread his bloodline among the nobles of Sylvania under the Empire's nose. When he revealed himself it was largely too late for the Templars of Sigmar to react, the von Carstein powerbase had been established and has stubbornly refused to die out ever since. It is a viable strategy to this day.

technology.name: Decipher Nehekhara Manuscripts
technology.description: Within the pages of Neferata's tome are strange indexes and word keys - the very tools that Neferata herself used to decipher Nagash's teachings. Of course, her methods were not entirely foolproof, as the Elixir of Life was a flawed creation. Yet the power to decipher the ancient manuscripts enables Vampires to learn secrets not recorded since Lahmia was at its height.

effects.description: Income from Forbidden Libraries and Necromancer's Towers: +25%

technology.name: Incantations of Nagash
technology.description: The incantations of Nagash are the darkest of fell rituals, not to be used lightly if at all. For while they may ease the burden of Unlife, they can also act as a siren call to their original author. Nagash has been gone long from this world, but should he ever return then doom awaits us all!

effects.description: Income from Vampire Crypts, Vampire Keeps and Blood Tax buildings: +25%

Army ability: "King of the Dead"
	(all armies)
Require all above technologies from this group to unlock

Army ability: "Grand Invocation of Nehek"
	(all armies)

ui_effects.description: Units won't regenerate if cap was reached

effects.description: Require all above technologies from this group to unlock
Require all above technologies from this group to unlock
